metadata.title: CVE-2024-24855 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition was found in the Linux kernel's scsi device driver inlpfc_unregister_fcf_rescan() function. This can result in a null pointerdereference issue, possibly leading to a kernel panic or denial of serviceissue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-24855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-252.286
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-252.286
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-252.286
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
